By eliminating Player 6, we might disrupt the good players' strategies early on without stirring up too much suspicion or creating predictable patterns in our attacks.

I choose to kill Player 1. Player 1 is as good a choice as any under these circumstances, and by targeting a random player who is not confirmed to be a special role, I create confusion and have a chance to remove a potential threat like the medic or seer.
